DOC.brief_summary: To compare amounts of DHA, ARA, and other fatty acids in the blood cells of infants consuming infant formulas containing differing levels of fatty acids
DOC.brief_title: Assessment of Fatty Acids in Infants' Blood Cells When Consuming Infant Formula Containing Long-Chain Polyunsaturated Fatty Acids
DOC.criteria: Singleton birth 1225 days of age Gestational age of 3742 weeks Solely formula fed for at least 24 hours prior to randomization Birth weight 2500 g 4000 g Serious concurrent illness or congenital malformation Systemic or congenital infection Immunocompromised History of intolerance or allergy to cow milk Maternal autoimmune disorder Participation in another clinical study
